responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: 'Android: Stored Server Base Path Allows Path Traversal'
    analysis: |
      The Android implementation of the `IonicWebViewEngine` stores the path to the server's files in shared preferences (which is an XML file) with the key `CDV_SERVER_PATH`, then loads this path when the app starts. A malicious app with write access to shared preferences could modify `CDV_SERVER_PATH` to point to files outside of the intended directory, allowing it to read arbitrary files on the device.
    cwe: CWE-22
    function_names:
      - setServerBasePath
      - init
    filenames:
      - src/android/com/ionicframework/cordova/webview/IonicWebViewEngine.java
      - src/android/com/ionicframework/cordova/webview/IonicWebView.java
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Android: Stored Server Base Path Allows Path Traversal
leads.analysis: The Android implementation of the IonicWebViewEngine stores the path to the server's files in shared preferences (which is an XML file) with the key CDV_SERVER_PATH, then loads this path when the app starts. A malicious app with write access to shared preferences could modify CDV_SERVER_PATH to point to files outside of the intended directory, allowing it to read arbitrary files on the device.
